creator: calestyo@scientia.net
text: May I suggest to clarify the syntax of the mime.types file at http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_mime.html#typesconfig to include, that lines containing only a mime-type but not an extension (which seems to be very common) are ignored (as far as I understood).

creator: i.galic@brainsware.org
text:
I think a better suggestion would be to change

""" Most administrators use the provided mime.types file, """

to

""" Most administrators use the mime.types file provided by their OS, """

Anyway, I'm not entirely sure about your interpretation. The documentation on this is very vague: http://www.freebsd.org/cgi/man.cgi?query=mime.types&apropos=0&sektion=0&manpath=FreeBSD+8.1-RELEASE+and+Ports&format=html

creator: calestyo@scientia.net
text:
Yes, adding that (I mean that most use the distro-version) is a good idea.

Well my distro's (Debian) version contains many lines like:
application/activemessage

(with no extension as 2nd filed)

And IMHO it should be clarified, that those are (I guess) ignored.
